author: captainunderoos
title: These traded-away Yankees have been huge busts
summary: Gleyber Torres could be promoted as early as Wednesday without accumulating a year's service time this season, thus, allowing the Yankees to get basically seven seasons of service out of him rather than six before free agency. He is a candidate to soon play third base because even with better signs of late from Miguel Andujar, Yankees third basemen rank third worst in how Fangraphs computes Wins Above Replacement, which attempts to provide an overall stat for hitting, fielding and baserunning. But for the Yankees, it possibly could be worse — they could still have Chase Headley. With the Padres, Headley had opened the season with one hit in 26 at-bats and 13 strikeouts. The hot-hitting rookie

author: third_watch
title: Cold temps postpone Cards-Cubs game at Wrigley; Gyorko, Gregerson activated
summary: CHICAGO • With temperatures hovering around freezing and wind chill expected to be much colder, the Cubs and Major League Baseball have postponed Monday's game between the Cardinals and Cubs at Wrigley Field. The decision came just as the Cardinals added some reinforcements. Infielder Jedd Gyorko and setup man Luke Gregerson have joined the Cardinals in the Windy City, and both have been added to the active roster from the 10-day disabled list. The Cardinals will maintain their planned pitching rotation for Wrigley, just nudging the pitchers all back a day.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: The Brewers' bench is made up of injured players and they need to DL someone
summary: During his tenure as general manager, David Stearns has shown himself not to be afraid of working the waiver wire or shuttling players back and forth from Colorado Springs to fill holes on the back end of the roster. He's gotten good at finding value on waivers and keeping fresh arms in a bullpen that's had to cover a lot of innings. But something he hasn't done well is making use of the 10-day disabled list. Back when a stint on the DL cost a player 15 days, it made a lot of sense to hold guys out for a few days to make sure they weren't going to improve. Nobody wants to lose a player for a half of a month, after all, and that made it a tough decision to deactivate a player for that long, especially

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: The Royals should be offering extensions like candy
summary: The Major League Baseball league minimum salary is $545,000 per year. The highest paid player this year is Mike Trout, who will make a tick over $34 million. The second-highest salary in baseball is Clayton Kershaw, who will make $33.2 million this season. Trout is the best position player in baseball, and Kershaw is the best pitcher in baseball. Their status as the highest-paid players in baseball is appropriate. So, considering that context, let me present a question to you: how much do you think Jose Altuve is making? How much do you think he has made in his career? You know, Jose “five-time All-Star, reigning American League Most Valuable Player, World Series champion, Silver Slugger and

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: 10 Degrees: MLB's enormous attendance drop due to bad weather or something far worse for baseball?
summary: Attendance is down precipitously, enough that one league official expressed concern that this isn’t simply a manifestation of the weather but something deeper and more troublesome for the game.

author: DeltaBravo
title: The Sox should be patient with Blake Swihart
summary: I have mixed feelings about the catching situation in Boston, specifically about Blake Swihart. He's clearly the wildcard here but I think we're all aware of his potential; we saw glimpses of it during his 2015 stint in the majors when injuries to Christian Vazquez and Ryan Hanigan forced the Sox to call Swihart up to the majors. Swihart fared well enough in 84 games for us to remain encouraged about his future as he posted a .312 wOBA with limited power and while his plate discipline wasn't ideal, let's remember that he was only 23 at the time. Vazquez returned in 2016 and the Sox tried keeping Swihart's bat in the lineup by giving him reps in the outfield. Unfortunately, his season was cut

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Case of the Mondays? Watch LSU's Daniel Cabrera's Sunday walk-off homer for an instant pick-me-up
summary: The LSU Tigers entered the bottom of the ninth inning in Sunday's game against the Tennessee Volunteers down 7-3 with hopes of a series sweep looking dim after two dominant outings Friday and Saturday. The remnants of a celebratory shaving-cream pie still clinging to his face and uniform, a giddy Daniel Cabrera was wholly believable when he s… But LSU rallied back, rattling off 6 runs to complete the comeback, capped off by a three-run walk off home run from freshman designated hitter Daniel Cabrera. True story: Sunday evening, I had 700 words ready for my editors at the Advocate about how LSU failed to seize opportunities in its series fin… What's that buzzing over Alex Box Stadium?

author: DeltaBravo
title: Detroit Tigers News: All of the baseball is being postponed
summary: Playing baseball in March is admittedly absurd. Playing baseball in early April isn't so smart either, but by the time you hit the middle of the month you shouldn't be dealing with the types of weather issues the Detroit Tigers and other teams are facing right now. We are just a few weeks into the season, and Detroit has been postponing games at a rate that would make Morrissey ashamed. Let's hope things start warming up soon. Until they do, here are some links to keep you occupied. Wilson's rough start Reliever Alex Wilson is perplexed. After putting in work as a dependable mainstay of the bullpen in recent seasons, he's off to a bit of a rough start in 2018. As Chris McCosky of The Detroit

author: captainunderoos
title: The Phillies' playing time rotation is working perfectly
summary: Ever since the Phillies signed Carlos Santana, it was clear there was a major problem in the outfield - except during a game in an American League park, only three of Rhys Hoskins, Odubel Herrera, Aaron Altherr, and Nick Williams could play at the same time. At the end of spring, when the Phillies decided to keep rookie Scott Kingery on the roster to start the season, the problem got even worse. Like the outfield, there were now five infielders for four spots - Santana, Kingery, Cesar Hernandez, J.P. Crawford, and Maikel Franco. Assuming the Phillies were always going to give Jorge Alfaro and Andrew Knapp a 60-40 playing time split at catcher, and Pedro Florimon was the team's one true bench

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Padres hold rare NL West lead entering series with Dodgers
summary: There aren't any firsts happening at Petco Park on Monday when the Los Angeles Dodgers and the San Diego Padres open a three-game series. One, the Padres and the Dodgers start a series with San Diego ahead in the National League West standings for the first time in almost five seasons. Two, Robbie Erlin will be making his first start for the Padres since April 17, 2016.

author: DeltaBravo
title: Young MLB fans find perfect alternative to throwing a home run ball back
summary: Two young fans decided to make a deal with the home run balls they caught during the Rockies-Nationals game.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Dodgers' Breyvic Valera: Called up by Dodgers
summary: Valera was recalled from Triple-A Oklahoma City on Sunday, Pedro Moura of The Athletic Los Angeles reports. Valera was acquired by the Dodgers in an April 1 deal with the Cardinals and is 6-for-19 at the plate to begin the minor-league season. The 26-year-old is a solid contact hitter, having sported a higher walk rate than strikeout rate at nearly every level in the minors. He hasn't struck out in more than 10 percent of his at-bats since rookie ball in 2011. Valera will provide the Dodgers with infield depth while Justin Turner (wrist) is on the disabled list and Logan Forsythe battles a shoulder injury. Forsythe is ticketed for an MRI in the near future, and the diagnosis there should help

author: nanook
title: The most illogical technicality robbed a D-backs player of a home run
summary: Deven Marrero thought he had his first home run as a member of the Arizona Diamondbacks on Saturday night. After all, his fly ball to deep left-center field cleared the wall. But it was a base-running gaffe that had the Diamondbacks infielder called out on the play. As Marrero rounded first, Alex Avila went back to first as if he was going to tag. He retreated just far enough for Marrero to get about a step ahead of Avila. Marrero gave Avila an annoyed look, but the two straightened things out and continued the home run trot. When they crossed home plate, Dodgers manager Dave Roberts was already out to contest the mishap. And replays would show that Marrero indeed passed Avila, briefly. Marrero

author: captainunderoos
title: Mets prove they can win in spite of Mickey Callaway, too
summary: When Wilmer Flores delivered his third career walk-off homer Sunday afternoon, allowing the brave denizens of arctic Citi Field to depart happily with a 3-2 Mets victory over the Brewers, baseball's most surprising team proved another point: Their success can't be attributed solely to Mickey Magic. In fact, just like the other 521 men who have managed a modern-era Major League Baseball game, Mickey Callaway will have days when his players bail him out. A questionable sequence covering the bottom of the fifth and top of the sixth innings turned into mere postgame fodder as the scalding Mets added two franchise firsts to their résumé: Never before has a Mets team started a year 12-2, nor has one

author: DeltaBravo
title: Marte's 5 hits help Pirates, Nova beat Marlins 7-3
summary: When things became testy between the Pittsburgh Pirates and Miami Marlins, Starling Marte kept swinging. If the Pirates sought retribution for an inside fastball that sidelined Josh Harrison, Marte provided it by going 5 for 5 , including a ninth-inning homer to cap a 7-3 victory Sunday. Both teams kept their tempers in check even as two Pirates and one Marlin were hit by pitches.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Red Sox extend best start in 118-year history, beat O's 3-1
summary: Even playing in wild chills below freezing couldn't slow down the red-hot Boston Red Sox. Andrew Benintendi got three hits and the Red Sox extended the best start in their 118-year history, beating the Baltimore Orioles 3-1 Sunday at frigid Fenway Park. ''I was miserable, nothing short of miserable,'' Boston ace Chris Sale said.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: This time Wilmer Flores is the hero as Mets dramatically walk off
summary: Wilmer Flores didn't see it coming. He was laughing, and about to answer a question, when a chilly Sunday became more frigid, and orange Gatorade violently splashed down upon him, courtesy of Yoenis Cespedes. Flores should have been prepared. He knows what happens after a walk-off home run. With a nine-game winning streak potentially segueing into the Mets' first consecutive losses of the season, the Queens fan favorite extended their franchise-best start by blasting a two-out, game-winning solo homer to give the Mets a 3-2 win over the Brewers at Citi Field. The Mets' (12-2) first walk-off win of the season marked Flores' third career walk-off home run, and gave the National League-leading squad

author: captainunderoos
title: Swelling in right thumb keeps Posey out vs Padres
summary: The Giants are looking to get out of San Diego without a series loss and will be down their best player due to an injury. But, there's no reason to worry.

author: DeltaBravo
title: Sho won't go on: cold weather postpones Japan's Ohtani
summary: Severe cold temperatures prompted the Kansas City Royals to postpone Sunday's scheduled Major League Baseball game against the Los Angeles Angels, who planned to have Japanese sensation Shohei Ohtani pitch. The 23-year-old Asian ace has been a hit so far in trying to emulate legend Babe Ruth from a century ago and become the rare player to regularly serve as a starting pitcher and a batter. While the Angels-Royals game will be made up on June 25, fans won't have to wait that long to see Ohtani take the mound.

author: nanook
title: MLB celebrates Jackie Robinson day with controversial Chief Wahoo hat
summary: The decision to sell a Chief Wahoo hat celebrating Jackie Robinson Day is completely tone deaf.

author: captainunderoos
title: We know it's early, but let's dig into these inconsistent Cubs
summary: Jesse Rogers ESPN Staff Writer Jesse joined ESPN Chicago in September 2009 and covers the Chicago Cubs for ESPNChicago.com and ESPN Radio 1000. Follow on Twitter CHICAGO -- It happens every April. Is what you're seeing on the baseball diamond indicative of what's to come for the entire season, or will it be erased -- good or bad -- by the next five months? New York Mets fans are hoping the first month sets up the rest of the year, while the Chicago Cubs are just hoping to escape April without trailing by too many games. Some slow starts are more understandable than others. A year ago at this time, no one blinked when the Cubs basically went through the first month a .500 team, finishing at 13-11.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Cardinal Insider: Playing for pennies in the minors
summary: While this past offseason was dominated by angst for a handful of free agents and the millions they weren't making, the more common baseball story is Brebbia's — another trip around the carousel hoping for one more reach at the brass ring. And he's far closer than the hundreds of minor-leaguers who never whiff a big-league paycheck and would rather pocket the quarters than ride on a Merry-Go-Round. Rent is due. The line between the majors and the minors is as long as Interstate-55 from St. Louis to Memphis and as thin as the movement on a 100-mph sinker. But it's costly. “My first thought, though, sitting down at the hotel was, 'Damn, I wish I played better,'” Brebbia said a few days later. “As

author: nanook
title: Texas tops OU 5-3 in game two to take series, top Big 12 spot from Sooners
summary: Texas Longhorns baseball (24-13, 11-3 Big 12) scored a massive comeback victory on Saturday night, taking down the No. 17 Oklahoma Sooners (25-13, 8-3 Big 12) 5-3 in game two in Norman. The 'Horns fell behind 3-0 in the first, as the game began with a Chase Shugart lead off walk, passed ball, and Jake McKenzie error to put runners on the corners with no outs. OU would later notch three singles to score its three runs. While an early three-run hole would normally doom most Texas teams of years past, the Longhorns offense battled back. Kody Clemens led the charge, as his leadoff double in the fourth got Texas going. Zach Zubia then walked, David Hamilton popped out, and Ryan Reynolds walked to

author: captainunderoos
title: Mookie Betts Injury: Update On Red Sox Outfielder After Home-Plate Collision
summary: The Boston Red Sox received a bit of a scare early in Saturday's 10-3 win over the Baltimore Orioles. Boston's first run of the game didn't come without consequence. After Mookie Betts walked to lead off the ballgame, he raced home on an Andrew Benintendi double. While Betts scored on the play, he was struck in the back by the throw home and collided with Orioles catcher Chance Sisco. Betts stayed in the game for a few innings before being replaced in the fourth by Blake Swihart. Luckily for the star outfielder and his team, X-rays came back negative, and the injury officially was listed as a left foot contusion, per the Red Sox. Although Betts appears to have avoided a serious injury, it comes
